title: (x) XyloBrit logo geometric sans - ITC Bauhaus {Yves}
content:
can you help me identify this font please (see image)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042528im_/http:/typophile.com/files/963501b_4428.jpg)

 [‹ What is the Royal Mail / Post Office Typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042528/http:/typophile.com/node/42848 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typophile site fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042528/http:/typophile.com/node/42138 "Go to next forum topic")
author: clairefreckles

comments.content: I did think Bauhaus, but the sample font looked rounded and then there is that “y”.

Pffftt..

why did’nt they use the original Xylo? ;-)  
Gruppe VII - Antiqua-Varianten - Xylo  
Benjamin Krebs, Frankfurt am Main  
Erstguß 1924  
Hausschnitt

Georg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081011042528im_/http:/typophile.com/files/xylo_5283.jpg)
